attributes.action: Stop the regular assessment of persons with Epilepsy and life long disabilities
attributes.additional_details: Once assessment has taken place the decision to grant PIP or DLA should it be awarded it should be a one time process and not a regular assessment every few years as a or the life long disability will never change but instead only be treated. A person can work yes but some days may find it hard to work and that is then and where PIP or DLA is of help to the persons. So to avoid the financial stress and worry I believe the debate should be heard and argued to abolish the ongoing assessments
attributes.background: People who suffer with Epilepsy and other long term disabilities have to have regular assessments causing distress to the person and even financial hardship even though the disability is life long and will never change so the discussion should be heard in parliament to abolish the assessments

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action:

End reviews of PIP and ESA awards for people with lifelong illnesses
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593296
